page.title: 01Eilean Nan Ron
page.content: "Island of Seals" - uninhabited island off the shore of Oransay, Inner Hebrides - has rovided secure breeding grounds for Grey Atlantic Seal for almost a century and hundreds may be observed in the breeding season (late September through October). Good rough grazing produced excellent lamb but now abandoned and a large population of rates is supported in part by ample supply of gulls eggs. Heron's breed in the ruins of a kelpers cottage, and there is a large, well developed otter holt. An "erratic" bouler is reputed to hail from Iceland by Glacier deposit. Unmarked grave of an Italian internee washed ashore after his transport sunk by enemy action. Last chief of Clan Mc Phie slain here after his hiding place given away by clouds of seagulls C1620.
